reviewText: I'd really like to reccomend this game - But the problems it has and the cut scenes / frames of animation missing make this game tough to play on the PC. This is not the original disk version of the game that was released by other publishers instead it's been optimized for tablets and ported over to the PC. The mouse controls run too fast and there is no way to adjust this. The way you advance through some scenes makes it impossible or next to impossible to advance to other areas of the game. It's like you almost have to click through everything in the scene your in just to see if something happens where your character can advance. Some NPC characters in game you interact with have limited amounts of animation, but mostly have speech bubbles with audio voice overs. At least most of the FMV is here. Shame since this is a great game that you may want to play through once more - but only if all the bugs present in this game are gone.

reviewText: Reiterating that this isn't the original version of the game - it's been watered down and rendered pretty much unplayable without following a walkthrough, as the gameplay is jumbled and event triggers are unclear. You'll find yourself tracking down tiny prerequisites you missed a lot. Kind of a hellish experience when dealing with such a linear game, especially considering it's imo one of the most enjoyable point and clicks I remember ever playing, plotwise.\n\nYou'd be a lot better off tracking down a disk version of the game.

reviewText:
First off go to gog.com and pick it up there. You can pick up the first 3 of the series for 10$.
Secondly this is a good game you should definately check it out BUT get it from gog.com.

Story is certainly interesting and the graphics aren't half bad, but unfortunately it's a cheap IOS version. This isn't the full game and really waters down the gameplay which makes you really miss out on some key mechanics. I was extremely disappointed to see that this was the case but figured I would stick it out anyway as I had bought on sale. Puzzles, dialogue, and danger have all been cut from this release. There are only 2 areas where you can actually die, but given the system for progress you'll  litterally just come back to the moment prior to said demise. As for the gameplay itself it will allude to what you need to do but there were a few moments where I was just entirely lost. Trying to refer to a walkthrough is difficult as they point you to the puzzles that are absent here. There's just too many headaches here to warrant this purchase on steam when you could get the same thing and more from the gog release.

reviewText:

CD version= NO HELP, MORE PUZZLES, BETTER INVENTORY SYSTEM, NO BUGS, NO MISSING SOUNDS. The steam version you get this dumb help thing which literally tells you everywhere/everything you can get. Takes away almost 70% of the puzzles along with getting rid of the cool inventory sytem, and then downgrading graphics.

Pros

Cons
NOT LIKE CD VERSION!!!
MAny bugs *doors you must go through icon sometimes never shows up, causing you to restart
70% puzzles from cd version are gone
missing a lot of videos EVEN THE INTRO!!!
dumbed down to a 3rd grader could beat the game!

This game should have been like it was on cd. No icon to help/tell you what to do. All of the puzzles back along with the inventory system!!

reviewText: While this game started off promising as far as the look goes, I had a very hard time playing it. These games were known for being puzzle games. Well, they've removed the puzzles from this version. That means you're going along playing when suddenly you hit a snag because you have a feeling you're supposed to do something to progress. Except the thing you're supposed to do has been removed or - worse - half removed. I spent this entire game bumbling through almost-puzzles that made no sense. You better hope you don't get stuck on a puzzle" because any walkthrough you find will be useless
date: since the "puzzle" you're working on will be some ramshackle version of the one from the full game.\n\nI was very excited to play this game
recommended: but was not excited to experience a game so hacked up and broken it's virtually unplayable."

reviewText:
Alright peoples...
This game is TERRIBLE! At first, playing the first and second games, I was skeptical because of the graphics. Then, I saw there was a third that was released in better times with much better graphics... AND HOLY CRAP DID IT BLOW!

Let me just get something off of my chest here... I REGRET buying this game. It- it shouldn't even be considered a game! No, a game is multi-graphical art that includes puzzles and/or problems to solve, missions to complete. THIS! This piece of trash is a clutter of shredded pieces of puzzles and missions that are incomplete! Do NOT even try to use a guide, you'll get even more lost and confused... because THOSE are guides to the REAL game, NOT THIS MONSTROSITY!

I looked up the real game. It is LITERALLY $2.67 (plus shipping) on amazon.
http://www.amazon.com/Dreamcatcher-16694-WRP2-Dracula-3-Dragon/dp/B001SSKJB8/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1448173681&sr=8-1&keywords=dracula+3+path+of+the+dragon

See? I ain't lyin'!

The game is messed up on an atomic scale. ALL of the immersement is gone! Even talking to the NPCs has been watered down to freakin' speech bubbles... SPEECH BUBBLES! This wasn't done in the first two games at all! IT WAS ALL ANIMATED!
NO! Just... no.

Who did this? Who? And why? Seriously, why?
Why ruin a game and take out everything that's good about it and leave this shriveled husk of a... non-game".
Was it too costly to just take the entire game and put it on today's modern PCs for everyone to play?
Nope

Do yourself a favor

reviewText:
2¢ Review

Game Name:	Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon
Original Release: 	March 2008				  My Overall Grade (#/10):  		3		  Demo:  			No				  Workshop:  		No				  Level Editor:  		No				  Captions:  		No				  Controller Support: 	No				  Multiplayer:  		No				  VR Support:  		No				  Steam Cards  / Achieves:  No / No				  VAC:  					No		  Genre:  		Point n Click, Vampire					  Manual:  		No					  Metacritic Score:		65			  Full Audio Multi Language:  	English, French, German			  Win 10 / Crapple / Linux:  		Yes / Yes / No		  Recommended To:  		Point n Click fans, hardcore vampire fans			  Other:  	OK, I give up on this series for a while.  This visually is better than 1 & 2, but the story and horror aspect is just as weak.

It implements a slight hint system, which helps offset how buggy the game is, but it's not enough.

I'll not give you any spoilers but I would say it's a better game than 1 & 2, but that isn't setting the bar very high.  I wish it was scary, or tense, or something. Yes it's a point n click which makes it hard to build atmosphere but still.

I encountered a few bugs and even a crash.  I got past all but the last one, and that was because I was tired of working for this game.  To me it's not horror enough to be fun.  The puzzles don't add enough to the story to make it worth them being there, the cut scenes could add so much .... but they just keep the story plodding along.

This game is 8 years old and that's fine. But there is just so many little things I don't like about this game for me to give it a thumbs up.

Grab it only when it's $0.25 or less and be prepared to be underwhelmed (in widescreen though).
1¢ Review Pro:
Now in 16::9 HD
Better graphics than 1 & 2

Con:
Just as weak of a story as 1 & 2
Port, port, port, remake
Buggy

Overall: 5/10 -1 story, -1 buggy = 3/10

reviewText: It's really difficult to choose if I recommend it or not.\nFirst of all, I have to say that I like adventures but I hate their puzzles. It has a pretty decent story, much more interesting and twisty that the one of Dracula Origins" that i recently have played

reviewText:
Relive this Sony PS1 classic, available now on PC.  In this third installment, you play as a Catholic Priest, travelling to Transylvania on a research assignment.  Upon arrival, you encounter a strange disease that causes anemia, garlic allergies and puncture wounds to the neck.  Can our hero find a cure for this scourge?  Play and find out!
